Name: MVVM
Keywords: mvvm viewmodel compose hilt room retrofit kotlin
Best For: Standard modern Android apps with Compose UI
Anti Patterns: God ViewModel|Exposing mutable state|Business logic in View|Skipping repository
Notes: Default recommended architecture by Google. ViewModel survives config changes.

Name: Clean Architecture
Keywords: clean architecture usecases domain multi-module separation
Best For: Enterprise apps requiring strict separation and testability
Anti Patterns: Overengineering small apps|Unnecessary UseCases|Domain depending on data|Leaking framework types
Notes: Best for large teams needing strict boundaries. Domain layer must have zero Android deps.

Name: MVI
Keywords: mvi state intent reducer kotlin flow unidirectional side effects
Best For: Apps with complex state management and deterministic UI
Anti Patterns: State explosion|Mutable state outside reducer|Blocking main thread in reducer
Notes: Single source of truth for UI state. State is immutable updated through intents via reducer.

Name: MVP
Keywords: mvp presenter view contract legacy java
Best For: Legacy Android apps or teams migrating from Java
Anti Patterns: Massive Presenter|Tight coupling View-Presenter|Lifecycle leaks|Not detaching view
Notes: Considered legacy. Still in older codebases. Presenter holds View reference creating lifecycle issues.

Name: MVVM + Repository
Keywords: mvvm repository livedata flow viewmodel hilt room
Best For: Most modern Android apps following Google recommended arch
Anti Patterns: Repository becoming God class|Not mapping DTOs|Exposing Room entities to UI
Notes: Most commonly adopted modern Android pattern. Repository is single source of truth.

Name: Multi-Module Clean
Keywords: multi-module feature modules clean modularization gradle
Best For: Large-scale apps with multiple feature teams
Anti Patterns: Circular module deps|Shared mutable state|God core module|Tight coupling features
Notes: Enables parallel builds and independent feature development. Improves build times.

Name: Redux-like (Orbit MVI)
Keywords: orbit mvi redux unidirectional middleware side effect container
Best For: Predictable state with middleware and side effect management
Anti Patterns: Over-dispatching actions|Not using middleware for async|Navigation in reducer
Notes: Orbit provides Container hosting state and side effects. Built-in testing DSL.

Name: Compose-first
Keywords: compose state hoisting remember composable kotlin material3
Best For: New Android apps built entirely with Jetpack Compose
Anti Patterns: Business logic in composables|Not hoisting state|Overusing remember|Recomposition issues
Notes: Compose-first means entirely declarative UI. No XML layouts or Fragments needed.

Name: MVVM-C
Keywords: mvvm coordinator swiftui combine navigation ios
Best For: Modern iOS apps needing decoupled navigation
Anti Patterns: Navigation logic in ViewModel|Coordinator retaining views|Massive Coordinator
Notes: Coordinators handle navigation keeping ViewModels free of routing logic.

Name: VIPER
Keywords: viper interactor presenter entity router ios enterprise
Best For: Large enterprise iOS apps with big teams
Anti Patterns: Massive boilerplate|Unnecessary abstraction|Tight coupling|Protocol explosion
Notes: Each screen has 5 components. Very testable but extremely verbose.

Name: TCA
Keywords: tca composable pointfree reducer effect state swiftui
Best For: Composable and testable state management with SwiftUI
Anti Patterns: Overcomplicating simple features|Not scoping stores|Large monolithic reducers
Notes: Created by Point-Free. Every feature is a Reducer with State Action Effect.

Name: MVC
Keywords: mvc model view controller uikit storyboard ios
Best For: Small iOS apps or prototypes
Anti Patterns: Massive View Controller|Business logic in controller|Not separating networking
Notes: Apple original pattern. Simple but leads to Massive View Controller problem.

Name: MVVM + Router
Keywords: mvvm router swiftui navigation combine async await ios
Best For: Modern SwiftUI apps with programmatic navigation
Anti Patterns: Navigation scattered across VMs|Router God object|Not using NavigationPath
Notes: Routers handle navigation through NavigationStack. VMs focus on business logic.

Name: Clean Swift (VIP)
Keywords: vip clean swift interactor presenter worker router ios
Best For: iOS apps following Uncle Bob Clean Architecture
Anti Patterns: Excessive boilerplate|Request Response ViewModel bloat|Workers doing too much
Notes: Each scene follows unidirectional VIP cycle. Highly testable.

Name: RIBs
Keywords: ribs router interactor builder uber ios modular
Best For: Very large iOS apps with deep dependency trees
Anti Patterns: Deep RIB tree complexity|Viewless RIBs overuse|Builder God class
Notes: Created by Uber. Business logic in Interactors. Builders handle DI.

Name: BLoC
Keywords: bloc cubit event state stream flutter dart
Best For: Structured event-driven state management for Flutter
Anti Patterns: BLoC for trivial state|Not closing streams|Emitting in constructor|Nested BlocBuilders
Notes: Separates business logic from UI using Events and States. Cubit is simplified version.

Name: Provider + Clean
Keywords: provider changenotifier clean architecture flutter dart
Best For: Small to medium Flutter apps
Anti Patterns: ChangeNotifier God class|Not disposing|Calling notifyListeners too often
Notes: Provider is Flutter recommended simple state management. Scales for medium apps.

Name: Riverpod + Clean
Keywords: riverpod clean architecture code generation flutter dart freezed
Best For: Modern Flutter apps wanting compile-safe DI and state
Anti Patterns: Provider spaghetti|Not using autoDispose|Circular provider deps
Notes: Riverpod is Provider successor with compile-time safety. No BuildContext dependency.

Name: GetX
Keywords: getx controller reactive bindings flutter dart all-in-one
Best For: Small Flutter apps or rapid prototypes
Anti Patterns: Tight coupling to GetX|God controller|Not disposing|Overusing .obs
Notes: All-in-one package. Easy to learn but creates vendor lock-in. Not for large apps.

Name: Stacked (MVVM)
Keywords: stacked mvvm viewmodel service flutter dart filledstacks
Best For: Medium Flutter apps wanting structured MVVM
Anti Patterns: VM doing network calls directly|Not using services|Navigation in views
Notes: Created by FilledStacks. Structured MVVM with navigation and dialog services.

Name: Redux Toolkit
Keywords: redux toolkit slice thunk rtk query react native typescript
Best For: Large RN apps with complex global state
Anti Patterns: Everything in global state|Not using createSlice|Massive reducers|Not normalizing state
Notes: Redux Toolkit simplifies Redux. RTK Query handles data fetching and caching.

Name: Context + Hooks
Keywords: context hooks usestate usereducer react native lightweight
Best For: Small RN apps with limited shared state
Anti Patterns: Overusing context for frequent updates|Provider hell|Not memoizing context values
Notes: Built into React no extra deps. Performance degrades with frequent context updates.

Name: Zustand
Keywords: zustand store middleware persist react native typescript minimal
Best For: Medium RN apps wanting simple scalable state
Anti Patterns: Single monolithic store|Not using selectors|Mutating outside set
Notes: Minimal and unopinionated. No providers needed. Supports middleware.

Name: MobX
Keywords: mobx observable action computed reaction react native typescript
Best For: RN apps with complex domain models and reactive needs
Anti Patterns: Observable mutation outside actions|Not using computed|Circular store deps
Notes: Transparent reactive programming. Observables auto-track deps and update UI.

Name: React Query + Context
Keywords: react query tanstack context server state cache react native
Best For: RN apps primarily server-state driven
Anti Patterns: Using React Query for client state|Not setting stale times|Duplicate query keys
Notes: Separates server state (React Query) from client state (Context). Handles caching.

Name: KMP Shared Logic
Keywords: kmp kotlin multiplatform shared logic expect actual compose
Best For: Cross-platform apps sharing business logic with native UI
Anti Patterns: Sharing UI prematurely|Platform-specific code in common|Ignoring expect/actual|Monolithic shared module
Notes: Share domain and data layers; keep platform UI native or use Compose Multiplatform for UI.

Name: Compose Multiplatform
Keywords: compose multiplatform desktop ios android web jetbrains kotlin
Best For: Cross-platform apps with shared Compose UI
Anti Patterns: Ignoring platform differences|Not testing on all targets|Overusing expect/actual for UI
Notes: JetBrains framework sharing Compose UI across Android iOS Desktop Web.

Name: Circuit
Keywords: circuit slack presenter ui screen overlay navigation cashapp
Best For: Compose-first architecture with Presenter and UI separation
Anti Patterns: Presenter doing UI work|Not using CircuitContent|Tight coupling presenters
Notes: Created by Slack. Presenters produce state; UI renders it. Clean separation.

Name: Decompose
Keywords: decompose lifecycle navigation component kmp arkivanov multiplatform
Best For: Lifecycle-aware business logic components for KMP
Anti Patterns: Components doing UI work|Not managing lifecycle|Ignoring back handling
Notes: Multiplatform lifecycle-aware components. Business logic survives config changes across platforms.

Name: Server-Driven UI
Keywords: server driven ui sdui backend config dynamic layout json
Best For: Apps requiring frequent UI changes without app updates
Anti Patterns: No fallback for unknown types|Trusting server blindly|No schema validation|No caching
Notes: UI defined by server JSON. Enables A/B testing and instant updates without app releases.

Name: Feature Module Architecture
Keywords: feature module dynamic delivery modularization gradle convention
Best For: Large apps split into independent feature modules
Anti Patterns: Circular module deps|Shared mutable state|Feature depending on feature|God core
Notes: Each feature is an independent module with its own DI testing and navigation. Enables parallel development.

Name: Offline-First Architecture
Keywords: offline first local database sync queue conflict resolution
Best For: Apps that must work without network connectivity
Anti Patterns: Ignoring conflicts|No sync queue|Optimistic UI without rollback|No connectivity monitoring
Notes: Local database is source of truth. Changes queued and synced when online. Conflict resolution required.

Name: Feature Flags Architecture
Keywords: feature flag toggle remote config ab test gradual rollout
Best For: Apps needing gradual feature rollout and A/B testing
Anti Patterns: Boolean-only flags|No default fallback|Flag debt accumulation|Not cleaning up old flags
Notes: Decouple deployment from release. Enable features gradually. Clean up flags after full rollout.

Name: Modular Navigation
Keywords: navigation module compose route typesafe deep link graph
Best For: Type-safe modular navigation across feature modules
Anti Patterns: String-based routes|Navigation in ViewModel|Shared navigation state|Circular nav deps
Notes: Type-safe navigation with @Serializable routes. Each module defines its own nav graph.

Name: Unidirectional Data Flow
Keywords: udf unidirectional data flow state action effect single source truth
Best For: Apps needing predictable state management
Anti Patterns: Bidirectional state|Mutable exposed state|Side effects in reducer|State mutation outside flow
Notes: State flows in one direction: UI -> Action -> Reducer -> State -> UI. Predictable and testable.

Name: Dependency Injection Patterns
Keywords: di dependency injection hilt koin swinject constructor service locator
Best For: All apps needing testable decoupled components
Anti Patterns: Service Locator antipattern|Manual DI in large apps|Leaking scoped dependencies|Circular deps
Notes: Constructor injection preferred. Hilt for Android; Koin for KMP; Swinject for iOS; get_it for Flutter.

Name: Repository Pattern
Keywords: repository pattern data source local remote cache single source truth
Best For: All apps needing data layer abstraction
Anti Patterns: Repository as God class|Not mapping DTOs|Exposing DB entities|No caching strategy
Notes: Repository abstracts data sources. Single source of truth. Maps between DTOs and domain models.

Name: Micro-Frontend Mobile
Keywords: micro frontend mini app super app module federation dynamic
Best For: Super-apps with independently deployable feature modules
Anti Patterns: Tight coupling between mini-apps|Shared mutable state|Version conflicts|No isolation
Notes: Each feature team owns a mini-app. Loaded dynamically. Independent releases. Common in super-apps.

Name: Event-Driven Architecture
Keywords: event driven architecture eventbus mediator cqrs message
Best For: Complex apps with many loosely coupled components
Anti Patterns: Event spaghetti|No event ordering|Lost events|Circular event chains|Debugging difficulty
Notes: Components communicate through events. Decoupled but requires careful event design and tracing.

Name: Clean Architecture + MVI
Keywords: clean mvi architecture state intent unidirectional domain usecase
Best For: Enterprise Android apps needing both clean layers and predictable state
Anti Patterns: Overengineering|4-layer boilerplate|Unnecessary UseCases|State explosion
Notes: Combines Clean Architecture layers with MVI state management. Maximum testability and predictability.

Name: SwiftUI + SwiftData
Keywords: swiftui swiftdata observation macro model swift6 modern
Best For: Modern iOS apps with SwiftUI and SwiftData persistence
Anti Patterns: @Model in views directly|No migration strategy|Heavy queries in view body|Not using @Query
Notes: SwiftData replaces CoreData. @Observable replaces ObservableObject. Native Swift concurrency.

Name: SwiftUI + TCA
Keywords: tca composable architecture swiftui reducer state action effect dependencies
Best For: Highly testable and composable iOS apps
Anti Patterns: Overcomplicating simple screens|Monolithic reducers|Not scoping stores|Ignoring effects
Notes: Point-Free's TCA with scope-based composition. Every feature is independently testable.

Name: Expo Router
Keywords: expo router file-based navigation layout tab stack react native
Best For: Modern React Native apps with file-based routing
Anti Patterns: Not using layouts|Deep nesting|No error boundaries|Ignoring platform differences
Notes: File-based routing inspired by Next.js. Layouts replace tab/stack config. Deep linking automatic.

Name: Kotlin Multiplatform + Compose
Keywords: kmp compose multiplatform mobile desktop ios android shared ui
Best For: Full cross-platform apps with shared UI and logic
Anti Patterns: Not handling platform APIs|Monolithic commonMain|Ignoring iOS conventions|Poor Swift interop
Notes: Full UI sharing with Compose Multiplatform. Platform-specific APIs via expect/actual or Koin.

Name: Vapor + iOS Full-Stack
Keywords: vapor swift server fullstack ios backend shared models
Best For: Swift full-stack with shared models between server and iOS
Anti Patterns: Coupling server and client deploys|Shared mutable models|No API versioning
Notes: Share Swift models between Vapor backend and iOS app via Swift Package.

Name: Kotlin Multiplatform + SwiftUI
Team Size: kmp kotlin multiplatform swiftui ios shared logic native ui
Keywords: Share business logic in Kotlin; native SwiftUI for iOS and Compose for Android UI
Best For: Shared: Domain + Data + Use Cases; Platform: UI + Platform APIs
Tech Stack: Teams wanting shared logic with fully native UI per platform
Layers: Shared business logic; native UI; reduced code duplication; type safety across platforms
Structure: Steep learning curve; debugging shared code on iOS; swift-kotlin interop limitations
Anti Patterns: https://kotlinlang.org/docs/multiplatform-mobile-getting-started.html

Name: Modular Monolith
Team Size: modular monolith convention plugins build-logic feature module gradle
Keywords: Single app with strict module boundaries but no microservices complexity
Best For: build-logic/ (conventions) + core/ (data ui network) + feature/ (home search profile)
Tech Stack: Growing teams needing modularity without microservice overhead
Layers: Clear boundaries; fast builds; shared build logic via convention plugins; team ownership per module
Structure: Initial setup effort; module boundary enforcement; potential circular deps without strict rules
Anti Patterns: https://developer.android.com/topic/modularization

Name: MVI with Compose
Team Size: mvi compose model view intent unidirectional orbit state reduce side effect
Keywords: Full MVI with unidirectional data flow in Compose; Intent→ReducerState→UI
Best For: Intent → Reducer → State → UI; SideEffects channel for one-shot events
Tech Stack: Complex screens with many user actions; when state traceability is critical
Layers: Predictable state; easy debugging; time-travel; testable reducers; fits Compose model
Structure: Boilerplate for simple screens; learning curve; over-engineering for CRUD apps
Anti Patterns: https://orbit-mvi.org/

Name: Repository + Mediator
Team Size: repository mediator network bound resource cache strategy offline
Keywords: Repository pattern with NetworkBoundResource mediator for cache-then-network
Best For: DataSource (Remote + Local) → Repository (mediator logic) → UseCase → ViewModel
Tech Stack: Apps needing robust offline support with stale-while-revalidate
Layers: Offline-first; responsive UI; single source of truth; automatic cache refresh
Structure: Complex mediator logic; cache invalidation bugs; testing cache strategies
Anti Patterns: https://developer.android.com/topic/architecture/data-layer/offline-first
